title: NHS Notify CloudEvents Profile
$comment: CloudEvents allows arbitrary extension attributes. NHS profile: time (occurred-at) is mandatory though optional in CloudEvents spec.

specversion.$comment: CloudEvents version used. Core attributes: specversion,id,source,type (+ optional subject,time,datacontenttype,dataschema,data). Ref: CloudEvents core spec.

id.description: Unique event identifier (UUID v4 recommended) that is unique for the producing source.
id.$comment: Unique per (source,id). This should be a randomly generated guid that represents the id of the event itself.

source.description: Logical producer path starting with /data-plane or /control-plane followed by lowercase segments.
source.$comment: Must begin with '/data-plane' or '/control-plane'. Subsequent segments: lowercase alphanumeric or hyphen. No trailing '/'.

subject.description: Resource path (no leading slash) within the source; lowercase segments separated by '/'.
subject.$comment: URI path: must not start with '/', only lowercase alphanumeric and hyphen segments separated by '/', must not end with '/'.

type.description: Event type in reverse-DNS style: uk.nhs.notify.<domain>[.<subtype>...]; certain ambiguous verbs are disallowed.
type.$comment: NHS naming: lower-dot namespaced; allowed chars a-z0-9 and dots; banned tokens: completed, finished, updated, changed, processed, handled, status, started, failed.

time.$comment: RFC3339 UTC occurred-at (REQUIRED in NHS profile).

datacontenttype.description: Media type of the 'data' value; NHS profile fixes this to application/json.

dataschema.description: URI of a schema that describes data.notify-payload (if published).

notify-payload.description: Structured Notify payload containing domain data (notify-data) and metadata (notify-metadata).

data.description: Container object wrapping the structured Notify payload.

traceparent.description: W3C Trace Context traceparent header value for distributed tracing.
traceparent.$comment: W3C Trace Context traceparent (required when tracing used).

tracestate.description: Optional W3C Trace Context tracestate header value carrying vendor extension info.

partitionkey.description: Key used to deterministically partition events (ordering / scaling). 1-64 lowercase alphanumeric or hyphen characters.
partitionkey.$comment: Non-empty partition key for scaling / causal grouping. Must be 1-64 characters, only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphen.

recordedtime.description: Time the event was recorded/persisted (bitemporal) in RFC 3339 UTC; should be >= time.

sampledrate.description: Positive integer indicating how many occurrences this single event represents (sampling).
sampledrate.$comment: Integer > 0 indicating how many similar occurrences this event represents.

sequence.description: String representation of a 64-bit unsigned integer, left-padded with zeros to 20 digits.
sequence.$comment: Lexicographically comparable ordering string per source. Must be a string of exactly 20 digits, left-padded with zeros, representing a 64-bit unsigned integer.

severitytext.description: Textual severity level of the event (TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL).
severitytext.$comment: Severity text (TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL, etc.).

severitynumber.description: Numeric severity 0-6 aligned with severitytext (mapping consistent with OpenTelemetry).

dataclassification.description: Classification of the event data's sensitivity (public | internal | confidential | restricted).

dataregulation.description: Regulatory regime(s) applicable to handling of this data (e.g. GDPR).

datacategory.description: Data category or sensitivity grouping (e.g. standard | sensitive | special-category).

description: NHS Notify profile for CloudEvents 1.0 with selected extensions.

subject.$comment: When source is /data-plane..., subject must start with customer/{uuid} and may have further segments which are either lowercase tokens or UUIDs.
